content: @Dave Register Looking at b0daf4184. This means that we no longer supports legacy plugins at all, we just refuse to load them. Fine with me if you ask, but it will at least require release notes or so, right?
"legacy" in the old meaning, plugins installed in /usr/share etc.
There would be no plugins using the NSIS installer, saved at "...\program files\opencpn\plugins", suitable for Win 5.8 I suppose.

@Alec Leamas
"no longer supports legacy plugins at all"
Yep, that's my implicit proposal. For sure we cannot support them on Win or Mac, since we have no legacy plugins suitable for wx32. And in the fullness of time, as they say, we will have wx32 on all platforms. So let us make the break now..
As I said, fine with me. But we need to make it explicit
At a second thought, a cleaner way to do this is proably to remove the legacy dirs from the set of paths searched by PluginLoader. I'll file a bug, not to be handled until after 5.8.0.
We need the legacy dirs for the inbuilt 4 plugins.
Unless we decide to move them to user space, maybe not a bad idea? But Post 58.
